issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
Not sure if this is a bug or expected behaviour but...

In VPC mode where CLC is under significant slow-down due to swapping, I am seeing many zombie ASG instances after the system is left over night. I have seen this for the past couple days. The log seems to suggest that the instances are marked terminated, but later come back as running. 

{code:java}
[root@a-26 elb]# euca-describe-instances  | grep 0.0.0.0
INSTANCE	i-ae8ebbbf	emi-4e8452b3			running	elb	0		m1.small	2016-05-24T13:39:42.203Z	one				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-3af1347e	emi-4e8452b3			running	elb	0		m1.small	2016-05-24T03:56:22.198Z	one				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-94049470	emi-4e8452b3			running	elb	0		m1.small	2016-05-24T04:41:13.734Z	one				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-1f690f6d	emi-4e8452b3			running	elb	0		m1.small	2016-05-24T03:56:21.556Z	one				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-68fcbd73	emi-4e8452b3			running	elb	0		m1.small	2016-05-24T03:56:21.566Z	one				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm	x86_64
.....
{code}

These are relevant scaling activities:

{code:java}
ACTIVITY        8e7c9915-e0f4-41d6-800f-b1b1623a8281    2016-05-24T12:31:41.051Z        euca-internal-elb-000923634980-catapp-29-one    Successful              At 2016-05-24T12:31:39Z an instance was taken out of service in response to a health-check.     100     Terminating EC2 instance: i-ae8ebbbf            2016-05-24T12:31:39.604Z

ACTIVITY        f78022ca-6283-476e-b716-fdab48f94517    2016-05-24T12:15:43.397Z        euca-internal-elb-000923634980-catapp-29-one    Successful              At 2016-05-24T12:15:41Z an instance was started in response to a difference between desired and actual capacity, increasing the capacity from 0 to 2.   100     Launching a new EC2 instance: i-ae8ebbbf                2016-05-24T12:15:41.809Z

{code}

These are the logs when grep with the instance ID.


{code:java}
Tue May 24 05:15:44 2016  INFO [DefaultCryptoProvider:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation-10.111.5.68-one-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#8140] :1464092144383:DefaultCryptoProvider:GENERATE_CERTIFICATE:C=US, O=Cloud, OU=Eucalyptus, CN=euare:CN=i-ae8ebbbf, OU=Eucalyptus, O=Cloud, C=US
Tue May 24 05:31:29 2016  INFO [PersistenceAutoScalingInstances:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@2a13f74f[State = -1, empty queue]] Marking pending instance unhealthy: i-ae8ebbbf
Tue May 24 05:31:39 2016  INFO [ActivityManager:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:ListenerRegistry:listenerTasks.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#11547] Terminating unhealthy instances: [i-ae8ebbbf, i-d842efee]
Tue May 24 05:31:39 2016  INFO [VmInstances:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:::com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequests/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#230] i-ae8ebbbf state change: PENDING -> SHUTTING_DOWN (previously PENDING)
Tue May 24 05:33:09 2016  INFO [ActivityManager:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@6d6f3a44[State = -1, empty queue]] Terminating untracked auto scaling instances: [i-0759bfb7, i-5b8fa4c4, i-d842efee, i-f6d036ed, i-ae8ebbbf, i-1c6ec477, i-b677c185]

fields.summary: Swapping at CLC results in zombie autoscaling group instances

comments.body: Not a use case we're too concerned about (a swapping machine), but possibly an indicator of a problem that we'd want to fix. Probably a problem with 'terminate' path, which is invoked by AS.

This may be caused by EUCA-12416, where instances fail to terminate if the initial termination attempt was unsuccessful. After the (terminated) instance information times out the restore-failed unknown instance handler would be used and the instance would be visible again.
